document_name_accent: ung thu phoi khong te bao nho giai doan 3.json
document_title: Stage III non-small cell lung cancer: Symptoms and treatment
subsection_name: ung-thu-phoi-khong-te-bao-nho-giai-doan-3.json_3_How long can you live with stage III non-small cell lung cancer?
subsection_content:
The 5-year survival rate is the proportion of patients who are alive 5 years after the disease is first diagnosed.
According to the American Cancer Society, the 5-year survival rate for stage III non-small cell lung cancer is: (4)
Stage IIIA: 36%; Stage IIIB: 26%; Stage IIIC: 13%
A patient's prognosis can improve in some cases such as: Weight loss is not too severe before treatment (less than 5% of body weight); no lung infection, atelectasis or pleural effusion; Cancer responds well to treatment…
